page.title: 04Wellington 'Phone Exchange
page.content: The exchange in Wellington was opened in 1962 and will close in 1990.There are small local exchanges in Newport, Dawley,Stirchley,Oakengates and Shifnal. Your phone is connected to the exchange nearest to your house by a pair of wires called jumpers. Each cable into the exchange can take 1000 calls.About one hundred thousand calls go through Wellington Exchange each week.Telephone wires are pumped with air to prevent water entering them. When a call is connected a uniselector records the number.Every 3 months photographs of the numbers are taken and the telephone bills are calculated. STD stands for subscriber trunk dialling.The biggest bill in our area is that of G.K.N Sankey Ltd.
